Articles.Content:
Hey KSP players! I've been playing for 15 days now between other things in life, and I have to say KSP is awesome! What a great community. The reddit guys are fun to chat with too.

The most difficult thing I've done so far is send Jeb to Duna and back safely. I even got it in the first try, which is more than I can say about his first mission to Mun. I actually had to send a rescue mission to go get him after practicing a few more times with Bill or Bob.

As far as mods go, I tried FAR and I'm sold. The difference is 100% better as far as aerodynamics goes. I also use Procedural Fairings and Engineering Redux. Once you know how to do dV calculations the first time, you're golden. I'm a firm believer in learning how to do it once and then scripting a program to help you out from there on. That's we I do it in real life. I'm not going to use Mechjeb however.

Here is a picture for fun:

I made a probe to burn into Eve for science in career mode.
Hello Basketcase. Welcome to the forum, and congrats on your Duna mission.
If your playing KSP it can't hurt to be an aircraft engineer. Good luck!

Hello to you from a fellow aviation worker. I'm an AMT by trade, so I'm sure you and I can agree that there are tons of things to love about this game, and a few aerodynamic/flight characteristics that are just a little frustrating. :-P

Anyway, welcome aboard and enjoy your time here!

-Ryan
Welcome to the forums! Your probe looks great. Good luck with the landing.
